name: The Brown Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great historic hotel. Recently stayed here while visiting in Louisville. We booked our room through hotwire and got a really nice rate. I also sent them a message for an upgrade and it was granted. Rooms are very nice and spacious and clean. Staff was very accommodating through out our stay. Free internet service which is really nice to have too. Close to great restaurants and shops. Will stay again when in town.
reviews.title: Very Nice Historic Hotel
Classy historic hotel plus impressive service
reviews.text: Wonderful 4 day getaway to Louisville at this exceptional historic hotel. Gorgeous hotel and hotel room with attention to detail. Professional hotel service throughout the stay. Comfortable lobby bar was fun plus the cafe's Hot Brown was amazing. Bonus: The free trolley starts here and transports you around the downtown area.

If you're staying here it is probably the best choice in Louisville if you are not trying to hoard hotel points. The property itself is great - remodeled in the past 5 years or so, but still has the historic charm from the 20's. The staff is over the top accommodating and ensure you have a great stay. The rooms (I had a standard) are large enough and have giant closets and nice bathrooms.
reviews.title: Outstanding property, Hot Brown aside

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I ordered a Hot Brown from room service and am sad to say it wasn't the best I have had. Actually was far from the best, but it is where it was created so who am I to judge?
reviews.title: Worst Hotel Ever!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My fiancé and I stayed at this hotel for our anniversary. At first look it appears to be an upscale hotel but there were so many things wrong I would have rather stayed at a Super 8. The bed was so uncomfortable I couldn't even sleep. The view was of a dirty roof. When we stay at a hotel we love to get breakfast in bed. We ordered our room service and the food was so disgusting we couldn't even eat and they over charged us. To top off the worst experience ever, my fiancé left his wallet in the room. When we called we were told it wasn't in there. The guy who stayed in the a week later found it and facebooked him that he left it at the front counter for him. When we called to ask again they said no one had turned it in. A couple weeks later we got a letter from the post office that he had a package that was cod. It was his wallet that they had just dropped in a mail box. So not only did they lie to us, they compromised his personal info. So we over paid for horrible food, paid for overnight parking, and had to pay to get his wallet back. I never write reviews, but this hotel is the worst I've ever stepped into!
reviews.title: Nice Stay.

reviews.text: I have stayed at the Brown hotel twice. The rooms I've had have been spacious. The bathroom in this past stay on the club level had been updated. The club level was great with its generous offerings of food and beverages for happy hour and breakfast.
reviews.title: Updated Elegance

reviews.text: Saying that his hotel is amazing is an understatement. The front desk staff was amazing. They gave me a brief lesson and fantastic suggestion of what to see within the hotel. They were very helpful. Every single employee I ran into went above and beyond normal first class standards. I will be returning again and again.
reviews.title: Fantastic walk into history

reviews.text: Very elegant hotel of the first order from yesteryear; plenty of the modern amenities. My wife and I spent a week in Louisville at the Brown and enjoyed every minute in the room and in the city. The hotel is near to restaurants, shopping and banking which was convenient for us. Again the microwave was missing in the room; we could have saved some monies had there been one. We liked Louisville and the Brown Hotel, and would definitely return, and recommend.
reviews.title: Conference/vacation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We visited Louisville for the St. James Art Show the Brown Hotel in October 2013, and we stayed at the Brown Hotel because the TARC/PARC bus line left from the hotel's parking garage and went directly to the show all day. Our stay was wonderful. The rooms are larger than I expected and significantly larger than other fine hotels of that vintage. I learned that the hotel remodeled years ago and knocked out every other wall to increase bedroom size. The sacrifice was well worth it. Beds are very comfortable. Rooms are clear and at the right temperature. Furnishings are beautiful and appropriate. Baths are first-class and roomy.
reviews.title: The Brown Hotel is one hot hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff was excellent. The front desk made check-in easy. Room service was efficient and brought our tasty 12' vegetarian pizza, which was large enough for my wife and me to share. Our first evening, we had a quick bite at the charming Lobby Bar, where a guest treated us to an impromptu song at the request of the piano player. And you must try the Hot Brown open-faced turkey sandwich in the hotel where it originated. Delicious and hot!
reviews.title: Legendary Hotel Exceeds Expectation

reviews.text: This hotel was outstanding! The location was perfect and the conference rooms were amazing! I came in town for a conference and the staff went above and beyond for us. I would recommend this hotel to anyone and everyone!
reviews.title: Exceeded my expectations!
Always superb
reviews.text: We recently stayed one night at the Brown, our 3rd visit to this exceptional hotel. The front desk staff were incredibly helpful and welcoming (we didn't have a reservation and they were able to match the Expedia rate).

We stayed in a king suite, which is slightly larger than the queen suites we'd had previously. The bed was the most comfortable we experienced on our trip (which included 6 other hotels) and the room was very quiet - we could have stayed for weeks.
reviews.title: It looks old it smells old it is old

reviews.text: We had a very late dinner at the lobby bar - as always, the bartender was a knowledgable and gracious host, and helped answer many questions about the area and bourbon. We had the hot brown, which I'd never tried before despite growing up in KY - it was sensational. I'll have it again the next time we're there. I also tried the Bisontini, but as with previous visits, the balance was off (too much bourbon and not enough cream liquor). I'll have to remember to ask for a variation the next time, as there's no doubt we'll be staying here again. It's a gorgeous hotel, full of the grace and elegance of another era, just sitting in the lobby is a relaxing escape for travellers.
reviews.title: Excellent Staff, property and location

reviews.text: Did not like this hotel at all. The rooms are tiny and dated. When you open the room door it virtually touches the bed. Rooms are dark and dingy. Carpets in elevators are dirty. The lobby is nice looking.
reviews.title: * Extraordinary *

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed here recently after a busy day in Louisville. We were greeted right off by the doorman and shown where to park as well as given options for valet parking. We parked in the attached parking garage that was extremely convenient to the hotel. Check is was quick int he Grand Lobby. The Lobby is reminiscent to that of a movie filmed long ago. Our room had a king sized bed and a large bathroom. The hotel has a great bar area in the main lobby as well as two restaurants located within. The service was wonderful, and the staff very cordial and professional. We had a great sleep in a very quiet room on the fourth floor of the hotel. All in all a great historic hotel that is filled with grand beauty!
reviews.title: A Grand Hotel!
Great Experience Overall
reviews.text: I recently stayed at the Brown Hotel for three nights and received top shelf customer service. This historic hotel boasts a spacious room and bathroom, in addition to beautiful architecture that you just don't get in new hotels. I ate most meals at the hotel and did not have a bad meal. Hotel is in walking distance to the historic downtown area. Would definitely stay there again!

reviews.title: Lovely property
reviews.text: The Brown is conveniently located to many attractions and restaurants downtown; it is also on the trolley route which is a free ride if one does not want to walk too far. The historic charm is quite appealing, the staff is very customer oriented and our room was clean and comfortable (we were offered an upgrade, which was greatly appreciated). Parking is $20/night in the ramp next door and $24/night for valet parking.

Just stopped for dinner again, The Hot Brown. We dinned again in the area of the piano bar and we were surrounded by people at three different tables, one group of four and two couples all eating Hot Browns. I have reviewed the restaurant at the Brown Hotel in the past. This is the place I stop when traveling through KY. The Hotel is beautiful and first class but this is my stop for food on the way through not lodging. Someday I will stay here again but its to close to home for my first stop. Staff is great and this time our waitress asked if we would like a slice of Derby Pie. This was a first for me and all I can say is if you take the time to stop for a Hot Brown which you should if you are within 100 miles make sure to ask if Derby Pie is available also. You will not be sorry. I would also like to say that I think that KY Bourbon Barrel Ale is the perfect beverage with this dinner.
reviews.title: Dinner at the Brown Hotel

reviews.text: The staff was very friendly and helpful. The airport shuttle took us to and from dinner... Which was very convenient. The rooms were very spacious and clean But a little rundown... Our carpeting was frayed in spots. The in room coffee service was basic for such a nice hotel. Not sure we would stay here again for the price
reviews.title: Nice historic hotel in downtown Louisville

description: Located at the corners of Fourth and Broadway in downtown Louisville, Kentucky, The Brown Hotel is one of Louisville's most treasured landmarks. Built in 1923 at a cost of $4 million by J. Graham Brown, the hotel was a magnet for many prominent guests and celebrities during the 1920s through the 1950s. In 1971, two years after the founder passed away, The Brown closed as a hotel and later reopened as the Board of Education building.
